bjustin1010: Well these praises you poured on Prof. Wole Soyinka is subjective. Yes he has written books that earned him the Laurent award which I totally believe that should have gone to Prof. Achebe . As we all know most of Achebe’s books are used for studies in almost all the countries in Africa and translated and read in all parts of the world. However Achebe being an Igbo man diffused the fear of what the boss will say with special reference to the British who he diplomatically and also openly critiqued especially in “ Things fall Apart” and other books . He also wrote about the evil of the northerners in Nigeria . This was even when freedom of speech was like one sitting on the gun powder in the military regime. Achebe has been considered controversial because of his brevity in speaking out the truth. Few days ago watching “university challenge “ on BBC here in the Uk and seeing a question in Achebe’s picture , I was happen and proud of my Igbo heritage but I paused and asked why he never received any prominent award . Well Soyinka has a lot to do . The silence and quietude coming from people like him in a place like Nigeria where the dumbest of dumbest rule a country with millions of educated professionals , she should be the name on everyone’s mouth as a model of freedom of speech .
mokenofficial: Literally the intellectual footprints of Africa is the foundation on which civilization was built, the knowledge, body of work and inspiration of Prof Wole Soyinka is more than the spiritual wings on which we all as Africans are using to fly into most meaningful worldly and transforming places. Thank you noble sister Chimamanda .
